Empty states#

Empty states/blank slates are commonly used as placeholders for first time use, empty data and error screens. Often times when mocking up a page, or when there simply isnt enough content to properly fill up a page enough, where a short page would cause issues with a footer, sidebar or other such isssues, you can quickly add in an Empty Module to quickly get back to building your application, without having to huddle up and brainstorm all day to simply fill out an error page or a thank you confirmation element.

Example One#

Example One shows the basic structure of an empty layout placeholder module.

You have no new messages

Click the button to start a conversation

Example Two#

Example Two shows the a slightly more complex structure of an empty layout placeholder module.

You've successfully signed up

Click the button to invite your friends

Example Thrice#

Example Thrice is an empty placeholder module with form controls mocked inside it.

You are not following anyone

Start to meet new friends

An empty state component can include icons, messages (title and subtitle messages) and action buttons or any combination of those elements. Add empty-icon, empty-title, empty-subtitle or empty-action to the elements. HTML structure is exampled below. 

<div class="empty">
  <div class="empty-icon">
    <i class="icon icon-people"></i>
  </div>
  <p class="empty-title h5">You have no new messages</p>
  <p class="empty-subtitle">Click the button to start a conversation.</p>
  <div class="empty-action">
    <button class="btn btn-primary">Send a message</button>
  </div>
</div>
